metadata.Title: CVE-2021-24032 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Beginning in v1.4.1 and prior to v1.4.9, due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2021-24031, the Zstandard command-line utility created output files with default permissions and restricted those permissions immediately afterwards. Output files could therefore momentarily be readable or writable to unintended parties.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-24032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzstd1 - 1.4.4+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
zstd - 1.4.4+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libzstd package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.4+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1').
